benchmark_details.name: Reasoning Order as Benchmark
benchmark_details.overview: This benchmark method assesses the consistency of large language model reasoning processes by comparing outputs generated through answer-first and logic-first prompts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective is to evaluate the consistency of reasoning in large language models by utilizing different prompting strategies.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Due to budget constraints, experiments were limited to smaller datasets and fewer LLMs.

data.source: Datasets used include MMLU, TruthfulQA, LogiQA, and BigBench.
data.size: 1,531 multiple choice questions (MMLU); 817 questions (TruthfulQA); 1,000 questions (LogiQA); 447 questions (BigBench)

methods: Comparison of answer-first and logic-first prompts
methodology.calculation: Accuracies are calculated based on model outputs for multiple choice questions; correlations are evaluated between consistency and accuracy across models.
methodology.interpretation: Higher consistency and accuracy indicate better reliability of language model outputs.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline comparisons presented across various prompts resulted in nuanced performance differentials.
methodology.validation: Experimental validation through multiple reasoning datasets and comparison across prompt types.
